text: The AP-1 site at -150 bp , but not the NF-kappa B site , is likely to represent the major target of protein kinase C in the <extra_id_0> interleukin 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .
Stimulation of T cells with antigen results in activation of several kinases , including protein kinase C ( PKC ) , that may mediate the later induction of activation - related genes .

We have examined the potential role of PKC in induction of the <extra_id_0> interleukin 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) gene in T cells stimulated through the T cell receptor / CD3 complex .

text: We have previously shown that prolonged treatment of the untransformed T cell clone Ar-5 with phorbol esters results in downmodulation of the alpha and beta isozymes of PKC , and abrogates induction of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA and protein .

text: Here we show that phorbol ester treatment also abolishes induction of <extra_id_0> chloramphenicol acetyltransferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity in Ar-5 cells transfected with a plasmid containing the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter linked to this reporter gene .

text: The <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter contains binding sites for nuclear factors including <extra_id_0> NFAT-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , Oct , NF-kappa B , and AP-1 , which are all potentially sensitive to activation of PKC .

We show that induction of a trimer of the NFAT and Oct sites is not sensitive to phorbol ester treatment , and that mutations in the NF-kappa B site have no effect on inducibility of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

text: In contrast , mutations in the AP-1 site located at -150 bp almost completely abrogate induction of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter , and appearance of an inducible nuclear factor binding to this site is sensitive to PKC depletion .

text: Moreover , cotransfections with <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression plasmids markedly enhance induction of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter in minimally stimulated T cells .

text: Our results indicate that the AP-1 site at -150 bp represents a major , if not the only , site of PKC responsiveness in the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .
